But, isn't that because he's building mana? And not from the tanky stats? If so, then he still pays to be tanky, since the mana of the item that he pays for is included in its cost.

The point trying to be made here is that as a rule, tanky items shouldn't also give you significant sources of damage. This is why Atma's Impaler was removed: it made your HP into an offensive stat. (Of course we still have {{champion:106}} and {{champion:113}} with dual hp scaling abilities but whatever). It's why Rammus and Malphite are monsters if they get fed, it's why Vlad is infuriating to fight. 

They get damage by building a defensive stat. You can't pidgeonhole them into a role, because their kit automatically lets them branch out in another direction.

> [{quoted}](name=PerishSoftly,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rNYqmlK0,comment-id=000a000000000000,timestamp=2015-04-14T14:03:35.590+0000)

This is why Atma's Impaler was removed: it made your HP into an offensive stat. (Of course we still have {{champion:106}} and {{champion:113}} with dual hp scaling abilities but whatever). It's why Rammus and Malphite are monsters if they get fed, it's why Vlad is infuriating to fight. 
> 
> They get damage by building a defensive stat. You can't pidgeonhole them into a role, because their kit automatically lets them branch out in another direction.

The difference there is that they get their damage directly from the defensive stats that they gain from the items, allowing them to build Randuin's Omen, Spirit Visage and other tanky items like that for their damage. Ryze gets his damage from mana, meaning that he builds Frozen Heart and Rod of Ages, instead of the full tanky items. Think of him like an AP bruiser with an unhealthy design.

You do still have a point, though, that you shouldn't be able to be too tanky and still have moderate damage. I think that the changes they're proposing on the PBE are aimed at solving this, but seems more like a nerf to be honest (though this is now somewhat off-topic).
